nodes.text: This isn't just about the 1619 project, it's about the project of stopping history about America and race from being taught, and you or your colleagues are going to get caught in the crosshairs if you aren't paying attention. \nLook for a tweet thread tomorrow.

@AntheaButler @karenhunter And denying her tenure is exactly the point I was raising when I asked the question about Black faculty in higher education. I hope I can help participate or lead in this discussion on the history of higher education.

So I am tired tonight, but I want to put this @UNC story with @nhannahjones in a broader context about what is happening now and what cons are doing.. This is a project that is about whitewashing (and I mean it that way) history, and you all need to get informed.
@AntheaButler @UNC @nhannahjones https://t.co/9aVSZw1kAV
@gonzarro @AntheaButler @UNC @nhannahjones Will it get better do you think?

@MAGIContheMic @AntheaButler @UNC @nhannahjones I'm Gen X so preternaturally inclined to be pessimistic but I do have hope that what is humane, just, and equitable for all species on this planet is possible.\n\nDon't let the bastards drag you down.
@DoloresPastor3 @AntheaButler @UNC @nhannahjones Don’t ask Black people to boycott their sources of income in the name of stopping racism. They have sacrificed enough.
@DiaMontgomery @AntheaButler @UNC @nhannahjones They?
@DiaMontgomery @AntheaButler @UNC @nhannahjones What do you mean?
@AntheaButler It’s historically incorrect - she is a race grifter ! End of story
@Swedishthink @AntheaButler State how it’s historically incorrect? Maybe it is. Maybe it isn’t. State why...

@AntheaButler 🎯 That’s why they try to change slavery into indentured servitude in textbooks and their new term “critical race theory” that tries to propose that racism is just a fabric of our imaginations when it’s well documented and embedded into the fabric of American history.
@AntheaButler @historianess @UNC @nhannahjones #Whitewashing history is exactly what its about.
@janeinak @AntheaButler @historianess @UNC @nhannahjones But even this terminology is problematic, isn’t it?
@DoloresPastor3 @AntheaButler @UNC @nhannahjones This ain't happening w/ Hubert running that basketball team. Crazily, I  think it'd have been more likely under Roy Williams.

@TroopaKing @AntheaButler @UNC @nhannahjones I hear ya on that one. But the leverage could be reversed if the athletes just w/drew their bodies to enable access for the Black academics. No university, esp. one as supposedly progressive as UNC, would want the blowback from such a boycott. Their image would be TARRED!

@AntheaButler @UNC @nhannahjones Know what would cure that whitewashing? UNC Black athletes' boycott. Professor Jones would be granted tenure w/lightning speed. Money talks & Black athletes bring in big time revenue.

@mass_ave @Fly_Sistah @jodotcom @AntheaButler Idk what y’all taking about we got like 3 days to talk about ww2 but every black history month we’d learn about black history, the whole month, every grade
@Snoof32 @Fly_Sistah @jodotcom @AntheaButler I’m sure you don’t know what I’m talking about
@MAGIContheMic @AntheaButler @UNC @nhannahjones Not reassessing their archaic views, catering to rabid religious/freedoms people, and constant capitulation from the opposing party.
@gonzarro @AntheaButler @UNC @nhannahjones How did one political party become the party if toddlers?
@Fly_Sistah @jodotcom @AntheaButler Schools are awful at teaching any history. State pacing is so bad that you could miss the fall of the Roman Empire if you’re sick a day.
@MAGIContheMic @AntheaButler @UNC @nhannahjones Not at all... when conservatives do it. 🙄
@AntheaButler @UNC @nhannahjones Is this cancel culture?
@TBrown512 @roberta_sparrow @AntheaButler @UNC @nhannahjones I've been following basketball since the Wizard of Westwood & yes, recruits should bypass UNC & publicly tell reason why.
@roberta_sparrow @DoloresPastor3 @AntheaButler @UNC @nhannahjones Yes we damn well should, we’re tired of this, on EVERY level.

@EmpathSeer @roberta_sparrow @AntheaButler @UNC @nhannahjones Think abt the impact that Black athletes boycotting would have. Money talks & all the powers that be would be at the front lines of social justice bc they're not trying to lose that revenue. It's too much money at stake.

@DoloresPastor3 @AntheaButler @UNC @nhannahjones Yes, for sure. But we also shouldn’t expect 19 year old kids to put their scholarships/livelihoods on the line in hopes that these fucks will figure it out.
@DoloresPastor3 @AntheaButler @UNC @nhannahjones Don’t make Black people sacrifice to end racism.

@roberta_sparrow @DoloresPastor3 @AntheaButler @UNC @nhannahjones Well, if education becomes affordable again, that would help. And do you really want to go to an institution that doesn't value where you come from?

@AntheaButler "One of the reasons that schools don't teach the civil rights movement particularly effectively is because we don't do a very good job of teaching the history that made it necessary, which is our long history of slavery"\nHistory books are fictional. https://t.co/XTDUWA22aa

@roberta_sparrow @DoloresPastor3 @AntheaButler @UNC @nhannahjones Much of the civil right movement was driven by young adults and Black young people must be aware of how dire our situation is and that extreme measures are necessary.

@Bluepearlnews @roberta_sparrow @AntheaButler @UNC @nhannahjones Yes, young Black athletes can recognize how historically their bodies have been exploited & use their leverage/labor/bodies to force social change. Too much money, professional/collegiate is made of Black athletes. They can make a difference. @stephenasmith @bomani_jones

@AntheaButler @UNC @nhannahjones Imagine learning that Nikole Hannah-Jones was joining your faculty for life, and your students could take her classes, but then your board of political appointees rescinded the offer because some racists wrote them letters.

@DTrowbridge7 @AntheaButler @UNC @nhannahjones This kind of push back is taking place at school board meetings all across the country. Imagine the Black parents and students who have to attend these public schools w/majority white pop. knowing the hostility they harbor against them. So much for SEL. \n\nThis feels like 1960.
@DoloresPastor3 @AntheaButler @UNC @nhannahjones Worked for Mizzou.

@DTrowbridge7 @AntheaButler @UNC @nhannahjones Too complicated to explain on Twitter, but it is not just “some racists” writing letters, it is the same group of rich, entitled white people who engineered the politicization of the Board of Trustees in an attempt to control what is taught at UNC. It is despicable
@roberta_sparrow @AntheaButler @UNC @nhannahjones If we had that belief, there'd be fight for freedom. How old was John Lewis? Roberta, that vision is blurred.
@DoloresPastor3 @AntheaButler @UNC @nhannahjones Thank you for your perspective.
@AntheaButler No it’s about stopping shit like this the whole point of this project is too prove that America is racist when in fact it isn’t

@DoloresPastor3 @roberta_sparrow @AntheaButler @UNC @nhannahjones Further, those protest were heavily organized and sponsored by established groups like ACLU, SNCC, urban league, NAACP, etc. And several Black student athletes HAVE protested over the years but they have very limited power.
@CrownVictoria22 @roberta_sparrow @AntheaButler @UNC @nhannahjones Okay, And? Does that mean give up?
@roberta_sparrow @AntheaButler @UNC @nhannahjones Have you heard of the Children's Crusade? \n\nhttps://t.co/A8oSVP7p5B
@AntheaButler @UNC @nhannahjones Indeed. People, get ready.
@DoloresPastor3 @AntheaButler @UNC @nhannahjones That's temporary. Black athletes going to HBCUs is a lasting and positive change on American higher education.
@DTrowbridge7 @AntheaButler @UNC @nhannahjones Imagine being as much of a dishonest dipshit as David:)
@AntheaButler maybe you’re racist.   why would you be devoted to an explicit racist history of america?

@jeeves1942 @AntheaButler You know there's an imbalance in history lessons. Similar to financial education due to a realization that mismanagement of money has long term effects, the missing lesson on Jim Crow is criminal.

@DoloresPastor3 @roberta_sparrow @AntheaButler @UNC @nhannahjones I’m sorry but your logic is misguided. As a former professor to student-athletes they have other things to consider. But I hear your passion.

@CrownVictoria22 @roberta_sparrow @AntheaButler @UNC @nhannahjones I'm sorry but my logic is right on time. As a professor to student athletes, I've taught them to look beyond sports. Passion and logic are not mutually exclusive.

@CrownVictoria22 @roberta_sparrow @AntheaButler @UNC @nhannahjones That's right & when Oklahoma had some trouble, Stoop was marching alongside the players, arm-in-arm. One thing those universities are not going to do is mess up that revenue stream & if Black athletes realized their power, social change would come at whiplash speed.
@roberta_sparrow @AntheaButler @UNC @nhannahjones How old was John Lewis, King, the Freedom Riders, the Greensboro Four, etc.  Why shouldn't we expect it? When should it be expected?

@DoloresPastor3 @roberta_sparrow @AntheaButler @UNC @nhannahjones This is not true. You have say 3,000 student-athlete spots/ yr. but you have 20K student athletes applying. Scarcity isn’t an issue. But the kids who were in freedom summer weren’t athletes: they were future theologians, lawyers, and academics who stood to gain. (1/2)

@DoloresPastor3 @roberta_sparrow @AntheaButler @UNC @nhannahjones To your point, the Mizzou football players did this in protest of Trayvon Martin and it worked: the president was fired and a 1/3 of the staff was eventually laid off b/c attendance dropped dramatically. (1/2).

@CrownVictoria22 @roberta_sparrow @AntheaButler @UNC @nhannahjones But if they refused to go to the school or if there boycott en masse, that law would have no teeth. It took a year for bus boycott to work & it took years to get voting rights. It took a minute for Gandhi to free India & Mandela to end apartheid, but it could work.
@CrownVictoria22 @roberta_sparrow @AntheaButler @UNC @nhannahjones If they'd boycott en masse. I hate typos. LOL Oh, well.

@DoloresPastor3 @roberta_sparrow @AntheaButler @UNC @nhannahjones To ensure that it never happened again, Missouri legislature wrote into law that any athlete who refuses to protest or not take the field will lose their scholarship & be legally investigated for breach of contract. 19 y/olds don’t deserve the weight of the state. (2).

@roberta_sparrow @AntheaButler @UNC @nhannahjones We shouldn't? Don't tell that to the Freedom Riders who put their livelihoods on the line for something greater than themselves. Maybe it's time for that grand vision again. Maybe that's why democracy's dying/racism's on the rise, bc our vision has blurred, dimmed, darkened https://t.co/bkHOI1leif
@roberta_sparrow @AntheaButler @UNC @nhannahjones You might also want to read "Letter from a Birmingham Jail" to gain insight into myopic vision
@AntheaButler the joys of a welfare education system. Letting the state educate our children makes drones, not citizens. Home schooling is where it's at.
@AntheaButler @DaLyahJ @UNC @nhannahjones I’m really trying to find words to articulate my rage and also my deep sadness for her because this whole thing is violent and painful.
@talespinningDJ @AntheaButler @DaLyahJ @UNC @nhannahjones Just...

@DTrowbridge7 @AntheaButler @UNC @nhannahjones If an appointee has family wealth garnered through slave industries, expect a racist push back. It's easier to avoid the historical truths of US slave breeding industries (for example), then turn down old influence$. One under the psychosis of whiteness shouldn't be on uni boards
@AntheaButler @BenjaminPDixon @UNC @nhannahjones Is there a petition campaign to start putting pressure on the board?

@DTrowbridge7 @AntheaButler @UNC @nhannahjones It'd be interesting to see what happens if a five star basketball recruit decides to take an offer from Duke or NC State over this. \n\nI mean, it shouldn't be connected but let's be real, it's connected.
@DTrowbridge7 @AntheaButler @UNC @nhannahjones And they're racists.
@DTrowbridge7 @RTMannJr @AntheaButler @UNC @nhannahjones That is a Board of Trustees that do not understand their role.
@jeeves1942 @AntheaButler We already know you are a racist POS. Crawl under a rock where you belong
@janeinak @AntheaButler @historianess @UNC @nhannahjones That's all that it's about.
@DoloresPastor3 @AntheaButler @UNC @nhannahjones Do the black athletes support racism too?  I hope not.

@AntheaButler I think it's even more about political power. Who sets policy at state universities, the elected and appointed leaders or the academic leaders? It's a shot to launch that war, a war that GOP leaders have every reason to believe they can win.
@DTrowbridge7 @AntheaButler @UNC @nhannahjones When you put it that way . . .
Are White People Bloodsucking Devils? -  https://t.co/g8IeK12WS4
@AntheaButler @UNC @nhannahjones Let’s let it all out. https://t.co/Nm5NfCS4As
@AntheaButler @UNC @nhannahjones No thanks 👍🏻
@sticksstonesx @AntheaButler @UNC @nhannahjones Lonleysadmansaywhat?

@AntheaButler I’m sure you’re aware, but, just in case (esp since Texas curricula impact the nation), here’s another data point for your coming tweet thread (which I look forward to reading):\nhttps://t.co/2eVE2oqErR
@AntheaButler @Ebonyteach @UNC @nhannahjones That worked in #MoveMississippiForward with the old Confederate flag.
@AntheaButler I look forward to that. Night @AntheaButler ✌🏻
